customer_name: Vermont Museum of Natural History Inc.

citations.narrative:
The opossum was housed in an outdoor enclosure that was not behind a perimeter fence. A perimeter fence is required to
protect animals housed at the facility from wild animals and unauthorized people contacting them and potentially
adversely impacting their welfare, and to serve as secondary containment. The facility must ensure that the outside
enclosure is behind a perimeter fence.
This inspection was a site approval inspection.
This site is not ready for approval to conduct activity covered under your current Animal Welfare Act License.
Conducting regulated activities at a non-approved site is a violation of the Animal Welfare Act.
Please contact your inspector to schedule your next new site approval inspection.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representatives.
n

narrative:
3.127(d) 
   
Facilities, outdoor. 
The opossum was housed in an outdoor enclosure that was not behind a perimeter fence. A perimeter fence is required to 
protect animals housed at the facility from wild animals and unauthorized people contacting them and potentially 
adversely impacting their welfare, and to serve as secondary containment. The facility must ensure that the outside 
enclosure is behind a perimeter fence. 
 
This inspection was a site approval inspection. 
 
This site is not ready for approval to conduct activity covered under your current Animal Welfare Act License. 
 
Conducting regulated activities at a non-approved site is a violation of the Animal Welfare Act. 
 
Please contact your inspector to schedule your next new site approval inspection. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representatives.
